chunks.text: tā<sub>u</sub> oṅkorñ(ai) srañciyeṃ;
tappre kauś yey. mā no nta totka rano parna präntsitär.
cākkär svastik nandikāwart ṣotr-una eneṅka celeñiyentär.
kentsa ipprer-ne maṅkāläṣṣana ṣotr-una lkoyentär.

raw_html:
<font size="-1">1</font> - tā<sub>u</sub> oṅkorñ(ai) srañciyeṃ;
<font size="-1">2</font> - tappre kauś yey. mā no nta totka rano parna präntsitär.
<font size="-1">3</font> - cākkär svastik nandikāwart ṣotr-una eneṅka celeñiyentär.
<font size="-1">4</font> - kentsa ipprer-ne maṅkāläṣṣana ṣotr-una lkoyentär.
en_html: 1 They boiled the porridge. 2 it went up high. But it did not overflow, not even a little. 3 The cakra, swastika and nandikavarta signs appeared within. 4 Over land and in the sky the good-luck signs could be seen.

chunks.text: -- ṣaḍap-ṣalywe-malkwerne ājivike upage tane tam-meṃ ynemane śem cau-k yke-ne.
päksemane oṅkorñai lyāka tāka āktike lau mā ṣ masa.
palska toyna ṣotruna śāstär-mpa ṣe rāmate istak śarsa :
se tā śuwaṃ oṅkorñai snai olyapo aiśamñe su yinmāṣṣäṃ.

raw_html:
5 - -- ṣaḍap-ṣalywe-malkwerne

ājivike upage tane tam-meṃ ynemane śem cau-k yke-ne.
        6 - päksemane oṅkorñai lyāka tāka āktike lau mā ṣ masa.
        7 - palska toyna ṣotruna śāstär-mpa ṣe rāmate istak śarsa :
        8 - se tā śuwaṃ oṅkorñai snai olyapo aiśamñe su yinmāṣṣäṃ.
en_html:
5 -- in sadap-salywe-malkwer-meter:

The mendicant Upaga going from there came to that place.
6 (While) cooking he looked at the porridge (and) was astonished and did not move at all.
7 He considered (and) compared these signs with the shastra, (and) suddenly he understood:
8 He who eats this porridge without equal will obtain wisdom.

chunks.text: akālk tsäṅkā-ne mäkte pi kca tā oṅkorñai ñiś śwātsi kallālle ṣeym :
ysaparsa yey āśirvāt weṣṣi teṃ epiṅktene sā<sub>u</sub> oṅko päs pyautka.
spʰarīräṣṣe aisemeṃ mutkārene aise mutkāntseś po mā tsuwa naumyeṣṣe bʰājaṃne ite śama.
lkālñesa ārttalñe taläṣṣeñca tāka erene kartstsa werene kartstsa śukene kartstsa krenta ṣotrunasa kekenusa.

raw_html:
<font size="-1">9</font> - akālk tsäṅkā-ne mäkte pi kca tā oṅkorñai ñiś śwātsi kallālle ṣeym :
<font size="-1">10</font> - ysaparsa yey āśirvāt weṣṣi teṃ epiṅktene sā<sub>u</sub> oṅko päs pyautka.
<font size="-1">11</font> - spʰarīräṣṣe aisemeṃ mutkārene aise mutkāntseś po mā tsuwa naumyeṣṣe bʰājaṃne ite śama.
<font size="-1">12</font> - lkālñesa ārttalñe taläṣṣeñca tāka erene kartstsa werene kartstsa śukene kartstsa krenta ṣotrunasa kekenusa.
en_html: 9 The desire arose in him: how could I in some way arrange to eat this porridge? 10 (While) he was going by (and) saying a benediction, in that moment the porridge became ready. 11 From a crystal bowl they poured it; the bowl did not even measure a complete mutkantse. It stood full in the bejeweled vessel. 12 With each look it was arousing his enthusiasm: good in appearance, good in aroma, good in taste, provided with good signs.

chunks.text: Upage ājivike eṣerñāna etsuwai masa weñāmeś ṣerśkana ñiś ostameṃ ltu nesau wärpauca dakṣiṇāke. ñi ka ṣ tāṃ oṅkorñai pintwāt petes.
toy weñāreneś sā oṅkorño tañ śwālya mā ste. pilycalñene lalālu laukito rṣāke tākaṃ rṣākeṃne śpālmeṃ cwi wes tā oṅkorñai pintwāt aiskem.
Upagentse mañu kärstātene. ṣañ ytāri masa.
Nānda cāla oṅkorñai Nandābala tāy ṣerśka postäṃ msāne. maitar yopar warttone dakṣiṇākeṃ ritasi wrocce rṣākeṃ.

raw_html:
<font size="-1">13</font> - Upage ājivike eṣerñāna etsuwai masa weñāmeś ṣerśkana ñiś ostameṃ ltu nesau wärpauca dakṣiṇāke. ñi ka ṣ tāṃ oṅkorñai pintwāt petes.
<font size="-1">14</font> - toy weñāreneś sā oṅkorño tañ śwālya mā ste. pilycalñene lalālu laukito rṣāke tākaṃ rṣākeṃne śpālmeṃ cwi wes tā oṅkorñai pintwāt aiskem.
<font size="-1">15</font> - Upagentse mañu kärstātene. ṣañ ytāri masa.
<font size="-1">16</font> - Nānda cāla oṅkorñai Nandābala tāy ṣerśka postäṃ msāne. maitar yopar warttone dakṣiṇākeṃ ritasi wrocce rṣākeṃ.
en_html: 13 The mendicant Upaga went up to the sisters (and) said to them: "Sisters, I have left the house a worthy recipient. Therefore give me this porridge in charity." 14 They said to him, "This porridge is not to be eaten by you. Should there be a stranger, a sage having exerted himself in austerity, (who is) best among sages, to him we will give this porridge in charity." 15 Upaga's hopes were dashed. He went on his way. 16 Nanda lifted the porridge (and) her sister Nandabala went after her. They went (and) entered the forest to seek a great sage worthy (of reward).

chunks.text: Indre kārpa rṣākäññe weṣ myāskate stām ñor cau lmoṣ lyakāre. śilāre-ne oṅkarñai wñār-ne purwar wesanmeṃ pinwāt rṣāka.
snai epiṅkte bramñikte kārpa totka maṃtstsaś aśrāmne peñiyacce yaknesa lyama ylaiñikte rṣākäññe weṣ memisku weñā-me-ś ṣerśkana ñi aiścer ce pintwāt epe se ññissa śpālmeṃ tākaṃ cwi aiścer.
Nānda Nandābala weñāre se cisa śpālmeṃ tākaṃ cwi aiskem. ylaiñikte bramñikteś mant ṣerpsa-me weñā-me-ś ṣerśkana sam rṣāke ñissa śpālmeṃ ste cwim nai kalas.
toy kakkāccuwa bramñikteś maitare wināṣṣar-ne oṅkarñai ṣarnene eṅkuwa weskeṃ-ne-ś.

raw_html:
17 - Indre kārpa rṣākäññe weṣ myāskate stām ñor cau lmoṣ lyakāre. śilāre-ne oṅkarñai wñār-ne purwar wesanmeṃ pinwāt rṣāka.

18 - snai epiṅkte bramñikte kārpa totka maṃtstsaś aśrāmne peñiyacce yaknesa lyama ylaiñikte rṣākäññe weṣ memisku weñā-me-ś ṣerśkana ñi aiścer ce pintwāt epe se ññissa śpālmeṃ tākaṃ cwi aiścer. 19 - Nānda Nandābala weñāre se cisa śpālmeṃ tākaṃ cwi aiskem. ylaiñikte bramñikteś mant ṣerpsa-me weñā-me-ś ṣerśkana sam rṣāke ñissa śpālmeṃ ste cwim nai kalas. 20 - toy kakkāccuwa bramñikteś maitare wināṣṣar-ne oṅkarñai ṣarnene eṅkuwa weskeṃ-ne-ś.
en_html: 17 Indra descended (and) took the guise of a sage (and) those seated under the tree saw him. They brought him the porridge (and) said to him, "Partake of our alms, sage." 18 Suddenly the brahma-god descended (and) a little below he sat in the ashram in splendid manner. Indra, having taken the guise of a sage, said to them: "Sisters, will you give me these alms or will you give (them) to him who would be better than me?" 19 Nanda (and) Nandabala said, "We will give (them) to whoever would be better than you." So Indra motioned to the brahma-god (and) said to them, "Sisters, this sage (here) is better than me; give (them) to him." 20 Rejoicing, they went to the brahma-god (and) worshipped him. Having taken the porridge in their hands they speak to him.
